{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3242110,"name":"Neil","username":"Neil2","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/f14d63/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-10-17T17:46:04.333Z","cooked":"

HI, Our team is currently trying to code swerve and we keep running into this problem were the module keep taking extra rotations to get to the desired position when trying to rotate. When we tried to increase our kp value for our turrning pid loop it keeps oscillating. We dont know if it is an issue with the pid or something else.

thorkiller35/ASwerve2023 (github.com)

Video: 20231016_193646.mp4 - Google Drive

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-10-17T17:46:04.333Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":112.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":442624,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-taking-extra-rotation-to-get-to-desired-position","display_username":"Neil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PoHXJK-G_HOudUMiljDRwD67D-wRJjJ-/view","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"20231016_193646.mp4 - Google Drive","clicks":11},{"url":"https://github.com/thorkiller35/ASwerve2023/tree/main","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - thorkiller35/ASwerve2023","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60928,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-taking-extra-rotation-to-get-to-desired-position/442624/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3242122,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-17T17:59:33.652Z","cooked":"

Did you enable PID wrapping? Not sure what encoder you’re using, but you’d want to tell your PID controller that 0 and 360 degrees are the samr position and it is allowed to “wrap around”.

The method you call to do this depends on what PID controller you’re using, onboard (REV vs CTRE) or WPILib.

I’m a part of Neil’s team. We use CANcoders, NEOs, and a navX.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-10-17T18:01:45.553Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":36.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":442624,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-taking-extra-rotation-to-get-to-desired-position","display_username":"Shoumik","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59843,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8866 | Jack of Some Trades, Master of Some"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-taking-extra-rotation-to-get-to-desired-position/442624/3","custom_user_title":"8866 | Jack of Some Trades, Master of Some","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3242127,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-17T18:04:12.324Z","cooked":"

Ah, then seeing as a Spark Max can’t use a CANcoder directly, you’re probably using a software PID controller.

In which case you wanna call PIDController.enableContinuousInput(minInput, maxInput)

Did you zero your modules? Also you can look to other teams that use your modules to get good PID values for your configuration of swerve module and motor choice.

How would one enable PID wrapping?

Posted above. Also as another user said, check if you’re optimizing your swerve module states. Your swerve modules shouldn’t need to ever turn more than 90 degrees.

You’ve already done that, in the code you posted last. It appears you’re using radians, so you’ve told the PID controller that -π and +π are the same.

Are you guys converting units correctly from the CANcoder? From it’s native units to radians?
